name: CreateOnCallSchedule
description:
Create a new on-call schedule in Datadog.

This tool is used to create a new on-call schedule in Datadog. It should be called when there is a need to set up a schedule for on-call duties, allowing teams to manage availability and response times. The tool returns a confirmation of the schedule created along with its details.

parameters.name: schedule_data
parameters.description: JSON object containing details for creating an on-call schedule, including attributes like name, layers, and time zone, and relationships like associated teams.

effective_date.description: The date/time when this layer becomes active (in ISO 8601).

end_date.description: The date/time after which this layer no longer applies (in ISO 8601).

days.description: The number of days in each rotation cycle.

seconds.description: Any additional seconds for the rotation cycle (up to 30 days).

interval.description: Defines how often the rotation repeats, using a combination of days and optional seconds. Should be at least 1 hour.

user.description: Identifies the user participating in this layer as a single object with an `id`.

members.description: A list of members who participate in this layer's rotation.

end_time.description: Specifies the ending time for this restriction.

start_time.description: Specifies the starting time for this restriction.

restrictions.description: Zero or more time-based restrictions (for example, only weekdays, during business hours).

rotation_start.description: The date/time when the rotation for this layer starts (in ISO 8601).

layers.description: The layers of On-Call coverage that define rotation intervals and restrictions.

name.description: A human-readable name for the new schedule.

time_zone.description: The time zone in which the schedule is defined.

attributes.description: Describes the main attributes for creating a new schedule, including name, layers, and time zone.

id.description: The unique identifier of the team in this relationship.

data.description: An array of team references for this schedule.

teams.description: Associates teams with this schedule in a data structure.

relationships.description: Gathers relationship objects for the schedule creation request, including the teams to associate.

data.description: The core data wrapper for creating a schedule, encompassing attributes, relationships, and the resource type.

parameters.name: include_relationships
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of relationships to return with the schedule. Options: `teams`, `layers`, `layers.members`, `layers.members.user`.

value_schema.description: Comma-separated list of included relationships to be returned. Allowed values: `teams`, `layers`, `layers.members`, `layers.members.user`.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of included relationships to be returned. Allowed values: `teams`, `layers`, `layers.members`, `layers.members.user`.

value_schema.description: Comma-separated list of included relationships to be returned. Allowed values: `teams`, `layers`, `layers.members`, `layers.members.user`.

end_time.description: Specifies the ending time for this restriction.

start_time.description: Specifies the starting time for this restriction.

restrictions.description: Zero or more time-based restrictions (for example, only weekdays, during business hours).

rotation_start.description: The date/time when the rotation for this layer starts (in ISO 8601).

time_zone.description: The time zone in which the schedule is defined.

id.description: The unique identifier of the team in this relationship.

data.description: An array of team references for this schedule.
